flashcards.question: The field of study where a function is created to map input variables (X) to an output variable (Y) by learning from data, without being explicitly programmed.
A type of supervised learning where the algorithm learns from labeled data, meaning both the input features and the corresponding correct output are provided.
A problem that occurs when a model performs very well on the training data but fails to generalize to new, unseen testing data because it has learned the training data "too much."
A type of supervised learning problem where the output variable is a continuous value, such as predicting the price of a house.
A machine learning technique that combines the predictions from an ensemble of multiple models to produce a more accurate result than any individual model.
